diagnostics.name: unexpected-eof
diagnostics.help: Check for missing blocks/terminators (e.g. missing `.end`) or unterminated literals.

diagnostics.name: unmatched-end
diagnostics.help: Remove the extra `.end`, or add the matching opener.

diagnostics.name: missing-end
diagnostics.help: Add a matching `.end` for the open block.

diagnostics.name: syntax
diagnostics.help: Check the syntax near this location.

diagnostics.name: unused-binding
diagnostics.help: Remove it, or use it (read it) to silence this warning.

examples.good:
fn main()
  set x = 1
  say x
  ret
.end

diagnostics.name: shadowing
diagnostics.help: Rename the inner binding to avoid confusion, or use the outer binding directly.

examples.bad:
fn f(x: i32)
  when true
    set x = 1
  .end
  ret
.end
examples.good:
fn f(x: i32)
  when true
    set y = 1
    say y
  .end
  ret
.end

diagnostics.name: unreachable
diagnostics.help: Remove the unreachable code, or restructure control-flow so it can execute.
